abstract: Nashville Mayor Karl Dean's $100 million proposal for protecting city from catastrophic floods, like May 2010 deluge that killed 10 people, is facing opposition from some lawmakers and politicians who claim plan neglects some parts of city; Dean has urged quick action and return to sense of unity that followed 2010 disaster.
lead_paragraph: After a May 2010 disaster, the mayor wants to pass a $100 million plan to protect the downtown area, but critics say more could be done to save lives.

headline.main: Nashville Debates How to Prevent Another Devastating Flood
headline.print_headline: Nashville Debates How to Prepare Before Next Devastating Flood Hits

snippet: After a May 2010 disaster, the mayor wants to pass a $100 million plan to protect the downtown area, but critics say more could be done to save lives.
